shortdesc.ph: Checks whether the camera supports Center Stage.
Checks whether the camera supports Center Stage.
Checks whether the camera supports Center Stage.
Checks whether the camera supports Center Stage.

section.p: Before calling to enable the Center Stage feature, it is recommended to call this method to check whether the current device supports it.
Before calling to enable the Center Stage feature, you are advised to call this method to check whether the current device supports Center Stage.
Before calling to enable the Center Stage feature, it is recommended to call this method to check whether the current device supports Center Stage.
Before calling to enable Center Stage, it is recommended to call this method to check whether the current device supports this feature.
section.note: This method is only supported on macOS.
This method is only available on iOS.
This method is applicable to iOS and macOS only.
This method is only applicable to iOS and macOS.

section.title: Timing
section.p: This method must be called after the camera is successfully started, i.e., after the SDK triggers the callback and returns the local video state as LocalVideoStreamStateCapturing (1).
You must call this method after the camera is successfully started, that is, after the SDK triggers the callback and returns the local video state as LocalVideoStreamStateCapturing (1).
You must call this method after the camera is successfully started, that is, after the SDK triggers the callback and returns the local video state as localVideoStreamStateCapturing (1).
This method must be called after the camera is successfully started, i.e., after the SDK triggers the callback and returns the local video state as LOCAL_VIDEO_STREAM_STATE_CAPTURING (1).

ul.li: : The current camera supports Center Stage.
: The current camera does not support Center Stage.
